DOC.brief_summary: The US obesity epidemic transmit next generation . Growing evidence suggest mother ' weight pregnancy onset , excessive weight gain pregnancy , associate increase risk pregnancy-related complication gestational diabetes pre-eclampsia , increased risk child become obese face obesity-related health issue later life . Currently , one-third reproductive-aged woman U.S. obese [ body mass index ( BMI ) ≥ 30 ] . Our research team show improve birth weight outcomes baby obese woman start weight-management intervention program 14 15 week pregnancy ( soon first prenatal visit ) . However , organogenesis metabolic program begin early first trimester , well first prenatal visit . Therefore , wait address mother ' weight , physical activity , diet quality first prenatal visit optimal . Given need reach overweight obese woman prior pregnancy , Institute Medicine 's ( IOM 's ) recent recommendation , base observational study , woman reach healthy weight conceiving , randomize clinical trial evaluate comprehensive preconception weight loss program .
DOC.brief_title: PREPARE : A Randomized Trial Pre-pregnancy Weight Loss Intervention
DOC.detailed_description: The goal help overweight obese woman ( BMI ≥ 27 ) consider pregnancy adopt improve dietary physical activity habit lose weight prior become pregnant , help maintain habit prevent excessive weight gain pregnancy . We model intervention successful , frequent-contact intervention design investigator . We start face-to-face counseling follow frequent telephone counseling contact . The expected outcome mother include reduce pregnancy-related weight gain ( primary ) low weight start pregnancy ( secondary ) baby , decrease risk exceed national norm weight birth ( secondary ) .
DOC.criteria: Current Kaiser Permanente Northwest ( KPNW ) member Expects KPNW member least 2 year Body Mass Index ( BMI ) ≥ 27 Not currently pregnant Access computer Internet Completion screen diet assessment English speaking Taking medication ( insulin pill ) treatment diabetes Gastrointestinal disease require special diet medication ( example , ulcerative colitis , celiac sprue , phenylketonuria ) Currently receive treatment cancer Renal disease ( kidney disease require special diet medication ) History bariatric surgery Use prescription weight loss medication last three month Another household member already participate Prepare study
